Package jetbrains.mps.classloading

Interface DeployListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LanguageRegistry
    public interface DeployListener
    Subscribe via ClassLoaderManager.addListener(jetbrains.mps.classloading.DeployListener) if you want to receive class loading notifications.

    Listeners are not guaranteed to have write lock inside the methods!

    API: A client must not throw exceptions in onLoaded(Set, ProgressMonitor) and onUnloaded(Set, ProgressMonitor) methods Otherwise the application may behave unexpectedly

    • Nested Class Summary

      static interface  DeployListener.ResourceTrackerCallback

    • Method Detail

      • onLoaded

        default void onLoaded​(@NotNull
                      Set<ReloadableModule> loadedModules,
                      @NotNull
                      ProgressMonitor monitor)
        Contract: The loaded modules are guaranteed to be deployed and module.getClassLoader() returns not-null. Essentially they are ready to give out classes. The modules will stay deployed until the corresponding notification in the #onUnloaded method.
        Parameters:
        loadedModules - are surely in the repository at this moment.
        See Also:
        ReloadableModule.getStatus()

      • onUnloaded

        default void onUnloaded​(@NotNull
                        Set<ReloadableModule> unloadedModules,
                        @NotNull
                        ProgressMonitor monitor)
        Contract: The class loaders of the unloadedModules are still valid (i.e. not disposed) Modules are still deployed however the modules might be reloaded and the corresponding ModuleClassLoaders might get disposed, essentially meaning that ANY use of instances of these stale classes might trigger ModuleClassLoader.ModuleClassLoaderIsDisposedException.
        Parameters:
        unloadedModules - are likely to be removed from the repository after this moment
        See Also:
        if for some reason you need to use the objects of the stale module classes after #unload event.

      • onUnloaded

        default void onUnloaded​(@NotNull
                        DeployListener.ResourceTrackerCallback callback,
                        @NotNull
                        ProgressMonitor monitor)
        There are some scenarios when user of the classloading subsystem would like to perform asynchronous actions with the MPS classes instances. For instance if these actions happen only in EDT whereas the #onUnloaded event comes by default not in EDT. For these cases one might use this method where the user has to grab the resource and, after he is done dealing with the objects of the classes of the unloaded modules, release them.
        Parameters:
        callback - invoke #acquire to get the unloaded modules and when you are done with releasing resources, invoke #release
